titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Palladium Flyers Collection MSS 441
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Laurainne Ojo-Ohikuare, 2015.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-09-02T10:25-0400

did.unittitle: Palladium Flyers Collection
did.abstract: From its opening in 1985 through the late 1980s, New York City's Palladium was one of the major features in the New York club scene, providing a venue for many different events. The Palladium Flyers Collection consists of flyers and posters for photographic, art, and fashion exhibitions and receptions as well as book publication releases, live performances, and parties. The scope of this collection gives insight to the distinct position of The Palladium nightclub and its involvement in the Downtown New York scene.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Palladium, formerly known as the Academy of Music, was a concert hall that transitioned into a night club in New York City. Located at East 14th Street, it served as a "hot spot" that catered to the downtown "new wave music" movement. From its opening in May 1985 through the end of the 1980s, Palladium was reserved as one of the major features in the New York club scene, providing a venue for varied events, ranging from live performances and parties to cultural exhibitions and publication celebrations.
After closing in 1997, New York University converted this landmark into a residence hall and athletic facility for undergraduate students.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Palladium Flyer Collection consists of flyers and posters for photographic, artistic, and fashion exhibitions and receptions as well as book publication releases, live performances, and parties. The collection documents the diverse nature of The Palladium nightclub and its service to the Downtown New York community.
This collection features celebrations hosted and attended by Stephen Saban, Michael Musto, Jeffrey Sanker, John Sex, Anita Sarko, and others.
The collection is divided into 7 series and corresponding oversize materials:
Series I: Photographic Exhibitions and Receptions contains flyers and/or posters to photographic exhibitions and various receptions hosted by different contributors.
Series II: Publication Releases and Receptions contains flyers and/or posters to book and magazine releases and receptions.
Series III: Art Exhibitions and Receptions contains flyers and/or posters to the art installations, exhibitions, and receptions that were both privately and publicly featured in Palladium.
Series IV: Fashion Exhibitions contains flyers and/or posters to fashsion shows and presentations to various fashion collections.
Series V: Theatrical and Dance Performances contains flyers and/or posters to ballet performances and play productions presented at the Palladium venue.
Series VI: Musical Performances contains flyers and/or posters to concerts to domestic and international acts and their after parties.
Series VII: Parties contains flyers and/or posters to birthday celebrations, anniversaries, and themed events.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Palladium flyers are arranged primarily at the folder level, divided into series based on the event. Folder titles are based on hosts and event title. At times titles were altered for the sake of uniformity. Oversize materials were removed from their original locations to allow for adequate housing and can be found in the oversize series in the finding aid. There is only one object, a plastic knife that was sent out as an invitation, which is housed in series VII.

Series I: Photographic Exhibitions and Receptions
Series II: Publication Releases and Receptions
Series III: Art Exhibitions and Receptions
Series IV: Fashion Exhibitions
Series V: Theatrical and Dance Performances
Series VI: Musical Performances
Series VII: Parties
OVERSIZE Series I: Photographic Exhibitions and Receptions
OVERSIZE Series II: Publication Releases and Receptions
OVERSIZE Series III: Art Exhibitions and Receptions
OVERSIZE Series IV: Fashion Exhibitions
OVERSIZE Series V: Theatrical and Dance Performances
OVERSIZE Series VI: Musical Performances
OVERSIZE Series VII: Parties
The arrangement was assembled chronologically by date. Materials without a year are arranged at the end of each series, in order by month.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Palladium Flyers Collection; MSS 441; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: NYU's Fales Library & Special Collections is not the copyright owner for this collection. Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Researchers wishing to reproduce collection material should contact rights holders for permission.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The collection was purchased by NYU's Fales Library & Special Collections from a bookseller in 2015.
